poem:
Title: "Towers Of Beijing, Reduced To Gamble"

In China's clutch, the soft ticks of commerce,
mortgage rates now paper boats in a lee,
seas of unsold homes, potential contours of solace,
like watercolor dreams repainted to be.

First-time buyers, tossed coins in the wishing,
their hopes on ribbons, fluttering at fifteen,
a dance with market's faltering rhythm,
a bet on futures, unseen.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "China to cut mortgage rates as part of plan to prop up property market China will cut mortgage rates and allow local authorities to turn unsold homes from developers into affordable housing, in a series of drastic measures by Beijing aimed at propping up the country’s faltering property market. The People’s Bank of China said it would scrap the minimum rate of interest and reduce down-payment ratios to 15% for first-time buyers and 25% for". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
